content:
ICommunicationObject Interface

In this Article

Defines the contract for the basic state machine for all communication-oriented objects in the system, including channels, the channel managers, factories, listeners, and dispatchers, and service hosts.

Syntax

Declaration

public interface ICommunicationObject

Remarks

The ICommunicationObject interface defines:

  • A set of open, close and abort methods for initiating state transitions:

    • Open
    • Close
    • Abort

  • Asynchronous versions of the open and close methods:

    • BeginOpen
    • EndOpen(IAsyncResult)
    • BeginClose
    • EndClose

  • A set of events that provide notifications of state transitions:

    • Opening
    • Opened
    • Closing
    • Closed
    • Faulted

  • A common State property for inspecting the state of an object

Properties summary

State

Gets the current state of the communication-oriented object.

Methods summary

Abort()

Causes a communication object to transition immediately from its current state into the closed state.
BeginClose(AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.
BeginClose(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object with a specified timeout.
BeginOpen(AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.
BeginOpen(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object within a specified interval of time.
Close()

Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state.
Close(TimeSpan)

Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state.
EndClose(IAsyncResult)

Completes an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.
EndOpen(IAsyncResult)

Completes an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.
Open()

Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state.
Open(TimeSpan)

Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state within a specified interval of time.

Events summary

Closed

Occurs when the communication object completes its transition from the closing state into the closed state.
Closing

Occurs when the communication object first enters the closing state.
Faulted

Occurs when the communication object first enters the faulted state.
Opened

Occurs when the communication object completes its transition from the opening state into the opened state.
Opening

Occurs when the communication object first enters the opening state.

Properties

  • State

    Gets the current state of the communication-oriented object.

    public System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState State { get; }

    Property Value

    • CommunicationState

      The value of the CommunicationState of the object.

    Remarks

    The main communication states available to an ICommunicationObject are:

    • CommunicationState CommunicationState

    • CommunicationState
    • CommunicationState

      There are also transitory states that such an object can occupy when transitioning between the first three main states:

    • CommunicationState
    • CommunicationState

      This CommunicationState defines the states that are valid for all communication-oriented objects in the system, including channels, listeners, the channel and listener factories, and the ServiceHost class.

Methods

  • Abort()

    Causes a communication object to transition immediately from its current state into the closed state.

    public void Abort ();

    Remarks

    This method indicates that any unfinished work should be ignored or ungracefully terminated before returning. The Abort method can be used to cancel any outstanding operations, including outstanding calls to Close.

    To gracefully transition an ICommunicationObject from the CommunicationState state to the CommunicationState state call Close.

  • BeginClose(AsyncCallback,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.

    public IAsyncResult BeginClose (AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous close operation.

    • state
      Object

      An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous close operation.

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationObjectFaultedException

      stem.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.BeginClose* was called on an object in the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The default timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to close gracefully.

    Remarks

    This method causes an ICommunicationObject to gracefully transition from any state, other than the CommunicationState state to the CommunicationState state. The BeginClose method allows any unfinished work to be completed before returning. For example, finish sending any buffered messages).

  • BeginClose(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object with a specified timeout.

    public IAsyncResult BeginClose (TimeSpan timeout, AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan that specifies how long the send operation has to complete before timing out.

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous close operation.

    • state
      Object

      An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous close operation.

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationObjectFaultedException

      stem.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.BeginClose* was called on an object in the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The specified timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to close gracefully.

    Remarks

    This method causes an ICommunicationObject to gracefully transition from any state, other than the CommunicationState state to the CommunicationState state with in a specified interval of time. The BeginClose method allows any unfinished work to be completed before returning. For example, finish sending any buffered messages).

  • BeginOpen(AsyncCallback,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.

    public IAsyncResult BeginOpen (AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous open operation.

    • state
      Object

      An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous open operation.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous open operation.

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationException

      The ICommunicationObject was unable to be opened and has entered the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The default open timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to enter the CommunicationState state and has entered the CommunicationState state.

    Remarks

    When an ICommunicationObject is instantiated, it begins in the CommunicationState state. In the CommunicationState state, the object can be configured (for example, properties can be set, or events can be registered), but it is not yet usable to send or receive messages. The BeginOpen method causes an ICommunicationObject to enter into the CommunicationState state where it remains until the open operation succeeds, the open operation times out or fails and the object becomes faulted, or the ICommunicationObject is aborted.

    In the CommunicationState state, the ICommunicationObject is usable (for example, messages can be received), but it is no longer configurable.

  • BeginOpen(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object within a specified interval of time.

    public IAsyncResult BeginOpen (TimeSpan timeout, AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan that specifies how long the send operation has to complete before timing out.

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous open operation.

    • state
      Object

      An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous open operation.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous open operation.

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationException

      The ICommunicationObject was unable to be opened and has entered the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The specified timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to enter the CommunicationState state and has entered the CommunicationState state.

    Remarks

    When an ICommunicationObject is instantiated, it begins in the CommunicationState state. In the CommunicationState state, the object can be configured (for example, properties can be set, or events can be registered), but it is not yet usable to send or receive messages. The Open method causes an ICommunicationObject to enter into the CommunicationState state where it remains until the open operation succeeds, the open operation times out or fails and the object becomes faulted, or the ICommunicationObject is aborted.

    In the CommunicationState state, the ICommunicationObject is usable (for example, messages can be received), but it is no longer configurable.

  • Close()

    Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state.

    public void Close ();

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationObjectFaultedException

      Close was called on an object in the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The default close timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to close gracefully.

    Remarks

    This method causes an ICommunicationObject to gracefully transition from the CommunicationState state to the CommunicationState state. The Close method allows any unfinished work to be completed before returning. For example, finish sending any buffered messages).

    The ICommunicationObject enters the CommunicationState state and remains in it until the transition to the CommunicationState state is completed.

    Close returns once the CommunicationState state is reached.

    If the default close timeout elapses before the ICommunicationObject is able to close gracefully, the ICommunicationObject is aborted.

    If Close is called on an ICommunicationObject in the CommunicationState, CommunicationState, or CommunicationState state, the ICommunicationObject is aborted. If Close is called on an ICommunicationObject in the CommunicationState or CommunicationState state, the call returns immediately.

    There is also an asynchronous version of the close method that is initiated by calling BeginClose and completed by calling Close.

  • Close(TimeSpan)

    Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state.

    public void Close (TimeSpan timeout);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan that specifies how long the send operation has to complete before timing out.

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationObjectFaultedException

      stem.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Close* was called on an object in the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to close gracefully.

    Remarks

    This method causes an ICommunicationObject to gracefully transition from the CommunicationState state to the CommunicationState state within a specified interval of time. The Close method allows any unfinished work to be completed before returning. For example, finish sending any buffered messages).

    The ICommunicationObject enters the CommunicationState state and remains in it until the transition to the CommunicationState state is completed.

    Close returns once the CommunicationState state is reached.

    If the timeout elapses before the ICommunicationObject is able to gracefully close, the ICommunicationObject is aborted.

    If Close is called on an ICommunicationObject in the CommunicationState, CommunicationState, or CommunicationState state, the ICommunicationObject is aborted. If Close is called on an ICommunicationObject in the CommunicationState or CommunicationState state, the call returns immediately.

    There is also an asynchronous version of the close method that is initiated by calling BeginClose and completed by calling Close.

  • EndClose(IAsyncResult)

    Completes an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.

    public void EndClose (IAsyncResult result);

    Parameters

    • result
      IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that is returned by a call to the stem.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.BeginClose* method.

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationObjectFaultedException

      stem.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.BeginClose* was called on an object in the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to close gracefully.

  • EndOpen(IAsyncResult)

    Completes an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.

    public void EndOpen (IAsyncResult result);

    Parameters

    • result
      IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that is returned by a call to the stem.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.BeginOpen* method.

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationException

      The ICommunicationObject was unable to be opened and has entered the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to enter the CommunicationState state and has entered the CommunicationState state.

  • Open()

    Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state.

    public void Open ();

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationException

      The ICommunicationObject was unable to be opened and has entered the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The default open timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to enter the CommunicationState state and has entered the CommunicationState state.

    Remarks

    When an ICommunicationObject is instantiated, it begins in the CommunicationState state. In the CommunicationState state, the object can be configured (for example, properties can be set, or events can be registered), but it is not yet usable to send or receive messages. The Open method causes an ICommunicationObject to enter into the CommunicationState state where it remains until the open operation succeeds, the open operation times out or fails and the object becomes faulted, or the ICommunicationObject is aborted.

    In the CommunicationState state, the ICommunicationObject is usable (for example, messages can be received), but it is no longer configurable.

    There is also an asynchronous version of the open method that is initiated by calling BeginOpen and completed by calling EndOpen(IAsyncResult).

  • Open(TimeSpan)

    Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state within a specified interval of time.

    public void Open (TimeSpan timeout);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan that specifies how long the send operation has to complete before timing out.

    Exceptions

    • CommunicationException

      The ICommunicationObject was unable to be opened and has entered the CommunicationState state.

    • TimeoutException

      The specified timeout elapsed before the ICommunicationObject was able to enter the CommunicationState state and has entered the CommunicationState state.

    Remarks

    When an ICommunicationObject is instantiated, it begins in the CommunicationState state. In the CommunicationState state, the object can be configured (for example, properties can be set, or events can be registered), but it is not yet usable to send or receive messages. The Open method causes an ICommunicationObject to enter into the CommunicationState state where it remains until the open operation succeeds, the open operation times out or fails and the object becomes faulted, or the ICommunicationObject is aborted.

    In the CommunicationState state, the ICommunicationObject is usable (for example, messages can be received), but it is no longer configurable.

    There is also an asynchronous version of the open method that is initiated by calling BeginOpen and completed by calling EndOpen(IAsyncResult).

Events

  • Closed

    Occurs when the communication object completes its transition from the closing state into the closed state.

    public event EventHandler Closed;
  • Closing

    Occurs when the communication object first enters the closing state.

    public event EventHandler Closing;

    Remarks

    This event occurs when the communication object first begins to transition from the CommunicationState state into the CommunicationState state, immediately after either the Close or BeginClose method is invoked.

  • Faulted

    Occurs when the communication object first enters the faulted state.

    public event EventHandler Faulted;
  • Opened

    Occurs when the communication object completes its transition from the opening state into the opened state.

    public event EventHandler Opened;
  • Opening

    Occurs when the communication object first enters the opening state.

    public event EventHandler Opening;

    Remarks

    This event occurs when the communication object first begins to transition from the CommunicationState state into the CommunicationState state, immediately after either the Open or BeginOpen method is invoked.
